alert.note: Alert for Kinney; Maverick; Uvalde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 28 at 12:53AM CDT until May 28 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT FOR KINNEY...NORTHEASTERN MAVERICK...NORTHWESTERN DIMMIT...UVALDE AND ZAVALA COUNTIES... At 1253 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 15 miles north of Alamo Village to 8 miles northwest of Cline to near Uvalde Estates to near La Pryor to 11 miles southeast of El Indio, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Uvalde, Crystal City, Carrizo Springs, Brackettville, La Pryor, Batesville, Laguna, Chula Vista-River Spur, Concan, Las Colonias, Uvalde Estates, Brundage, Dabney, Cline, Carrizo Hill, Anacacho, Reagan Wells, Loma Vista, Alamo Village and Blewett. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
